info.title: Oxide Region API
info.description: API for interacting with the Oxide control plane

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items returned by a single call

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Token returned by previous call to retreive the subsequent page

x-rust.example:
/**
* List racks in the system.
*
* This function performs a `GET` to the `/hardware/racks` endpoint.
*
* **Parameters:**
*
* * `limit: u32` -- Maximum number of items returned by a single call.
* * `page_token: &str` -- Token returned by previous call to retreive the subsequent page.
* * `sort_by: crate::types::IdSortMode` -- Supported set of sort modes for scanning by id only.
*  
*  Currently, we only support scanning in ascending order.
*/
let vec_crate_types_rack = client.racks().get_page(limit, page_token, sort_by).await?;

// - OR -

/**
* List racks in the system.
*
* This function performs a `GET` to the `/hardware/racks` endpoint.
*
* As opposed to `get`, this function returns all the pages of the request at once.
*/
let vec_crate_types_rack = client.racks().get_all(sort_by).await?;

get.summary: Fetch information about a particular rack.

parameters.name: rack_id
parameters.description: The rack's unique ID.

x-rust.example:
/**
* Fetch information about a particular rack.
*
* This function performs a `GET` to the `/hardware/racks/{rack_id}` endpoint.
*
* **Parameters:**
*
* * `rack_id: &str` -- The rack's unique ID.
*/
let rack = client.racks().get(rack_id).await?;

get.description: Returns a list of all the global images. Global images are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recent images appearing first.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items returned by a single call

parameters.name: page_token
parameters.description: Token returned by previous call to retreive the subsequent page

x-rust.example:
/**
* List global images.
*
* This function performs a `GET` to the `/images` endpoint.
*
* Returns a list of all the global images. Global images are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recent images appearing first.
*
* **Parameters:**
*
* * `limit: u32` -- Maximum number of items returned by a single call.
* * `page_token: &str` -- Token returned by previous call to retreive the subsequent page.
* * `sort_by: crate::types::NameSortMode` -- Supported set of sort modes for scanning by name only
*  
*  Currently, we only support scanning in ascending order.
*/
let vec_crate_types_image = client.images_global().images_get(limit, page_token, sort_by).await?;

// - OR -

/**
* List global images.
*
* This function performs a `GET` to the `/images` endpoint.
*
* As opposed to `images_get`, this function returns all the pages of the request at once.
*
* Returns a list of all the global images. Global images are returned sorted by creation date, with the most recent images appearing first.
*/
let vec_crate_types_image = client.images_global().images_get_all(sort_by).await?;

post.description: Create a new global image. This image can then be used by any user as a base for instances.

x-rust.example:
/**
* Create a global image.
*
* This function performs a `POST` to the `/images` endpoint.
*
* Create a new global image. This image can then be used by any user as a base for instances.
*/
let image = client.images_global().images_post(body).await?;

get.description: Returns the details of a specific global image.

x-rust.example:
/**
* Get a global image.
*
* This function performs a `GET` to the `/images/{image_name}` endpoint.
*
* Returns the details of a specific global image.
*
* **Parameters:**
*
* * `image_name: &str` -- Names must begin with a lower case ASCII letter, be composed exclusively of lowercase ASCII, uppercase ASCII, numbers, and '-', and may not end with a '-'.
*/
let image = client.images_global().images_get_image(image_name).await?;

delete.description: Permanently delete a global image. This operation cannot be undone. Any instances using the global image will continue to run, however new instances can not be created with this image.

x-rust.example:
/**
* Delete a global image.
*
* This function performs a `DELETE` to the `/images/{image_name}` endpoint.
*
* Permanently delete a global image. This operation cannot be undone. Any instances using the global image will continue to run, however new instances can not be created with this image.
*
* **Parameters:**
*
* * `image_name: &str` -- Names must begin with a lower case ASCII letter, be composed exclusively of lowercase ASCII, uppercase ASCII, numbers, and '-', and may not end with a '-'.
*/
client.images_global().images_delete_image(image_name).await?;

* This function performs a `GET` to the `/users/{user_name}` endpoint.
*
* **Parameters:**
*
* * `user_name: &str` -- Names must begin with a lower case ASCII letter, be composed exclusively of lowercase ASCII, uppercase ASCII, numbers, and '-', and may not end with a '-'.
*/
let user = client.users().get(user_name).await?;

ByteCount.description:
A count of bytes, typically used either for memory or storage capacity

The maximum supported byte count is [`i64::MAX`].  This makes it somewhat inconvenient to define constructors: a u32 constructor can be infallible, but an i64 constructor can fail (if the value is negative) and a u64 constructor can fail (if the value is larger than i64::MAX).  We provide all of these for consumers' convenience.

ipv6_block.description:

tags.name: projects
tags.description: Projects are a grouping of associated resources such as instances and disks within an organization for purposes of billing and access control.

tags.name: racks
tags.description: These operations pertain to hardware inventory and management. Racks are the unit of expansion of an Oxide deployment. Racks are in turn composed of sleds, switches, power supplies, and a cabled backplane.

tags.name: roles
tags.description: Roles are a component of Identity and Access Management (IAM) that allow a user or agent account access to additional permissions.

tags.name: routers
tags.description: Routers direct the flow of network traffic into, out of, and within a VPC via routes.

tags.name: routes
tags.description: Routes define router policy.

tags.name: sagas
tags.description: Sagas are the abstraction used to represent multi-step operations within the Oxide deployment. These operations can be used to query saga status and report errors.
